alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 10:22PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL PENOBSCOT COUNTY THROUGH 1115 PM EDT... At 1021 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Howland, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Howland, Springfield, Licoln Township, Enfield, Lee, Mattawamkeag, Chester, Winn, Passadumkeag, Burlington, Lowell, Woodville, Prentiss, Kingman, Carroll, Maxfield, Seboeis, Cedar Lake, and Drew Plantation. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 214 and 239. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
